actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Federal Police
assoc_actor_2: NaMA: National Movement of Amhara; Government of Ethiopia (2018-)
notes: On 4 August 2023, Federal Police arrested an opposition leader of NaMA and a member of the Ethiopian Parliament and chair of Standing Committee for Public Expenditures and Administration Control from his home in Addis Ababa, Lideta (Region 14, Addis Ababa). Some sources claim the police beat him during his capture. The reason is unknown, could be most likely related to the newly declared SOE.

source: Al Ayn; AP; BBC News; Borkena Ethiopian News; Deutsche Welle; EMS; ESAT; GardaWorld; TIKVAH Ethiopia; VOA; Wazema Radio
notes: Security measures: On 4 August 2023, Ethiopian Council of Ministers declared a State of Emergency (SoE) in the Amhara State to following days of armed clashes between the ENDF and Fano militia in several parts of the region (coded separately). The statement says, 'attacks of extremist armed groups' had reached a stage where it was no longer possible to control with regular law enforcement mechanisms', adding that the situation had 'endangered the constitutional order' and 'disrupted the people's overall economic and social activities'. Event coded to Addis Ababa, Lideta (Region 14, Addis Ababa).
On 4 August 2023, an unidentified armed group fired mortar and heavy weapons in and around Debre Markos town (East Gojam, Amhara). No further information. Casualties unknown.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Federal Police
notes: On 3 August 2023, Fano militias and ENDF continued to clash in Maraki, Kebele 18, and Tederos and Fasil campus of Gondar University areas in Gonder town (Central Gondar, Amhara). The armed clash began on the evening of 2 August (coded separately). At least 20 people were killed, including an assistant professor who was giving the 12th-grade national exam at Gondar University and two federal police who were guarding the university, and an unidentified number of people, including students in Gondar University and a federal police officer, were injured. The number of fatalities split into two events. Over 16,000 students were unable to take the exam.
On 3 August 2023, ENDF clashed with Fano militias in Asketema, Gazgibla woreda (location not found and coded to admin center, Sekota, Sekota town, in Wag Hamra zone, Amhara). Casualties unknown.

actor2: OLF: Oromo Liberation Front (Shane Splinter Faction)
notes: On 3 August 2023, in a clash that lasted for two days, ENDF clashed with OLF Shane in Kiremu town, Kiremu woreda (East Wellega, Oromia). Casualties unknown.

On 3 August 2023, rioters who opposed ENDF and the government's action in Amhara region and support Fano militias, looted the Police training center and public offices in Debre Markos town (East Gojam, Amhara) after Fano militias entered the town. Witnesses clearly stated that Fano militias were not involved in the looting. A day before this event, roads were closed (coded separately) and on 4 August 2023, heavy weapons were fired by an unidentified armed group in and around the town (coded separately).

source: Al Jazeera; EMS; Reuters; Wazema Radio
notes: On 2 August 2023, ENDF and Fano militias continued to clash in or around Debre Tabor town (South Gondar, Amhara). An unidentified number of casualties of Fanos and ENDF were reported and hospital sources claimed to have admitted around dozens combatants wounded. At least, three civilians, including two drivers of a Bajaj and a truck, were killed. The armed clash began on 1 August 2023 (coded separately). All roads were closed by stones. According to a witness, the armed clash began when ENDF tried to mobilize its soldiers from Gondar to Woldiya. The number of civilian fatalities split in to two events and 3 fatalities coded for combatants; fatalities coded as 4.

actor2: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) SNNP State Police
notes: On 2 August 2023, OLF Shane exchanged fire with SNNP Regional State Police in Bue, Bui town, Sodo woreda (Gurage, SNNP), when the armed group opened fire to attack a police station and release their members detained. At least two police officers were wounded and the armed group left the areas after clashing for an hour. There were no fatalities.

On 2 August 2023, a group closed roads with stones and sticks in Debre Markos town (East Gojam, Amhara) and Bure (coded separately), in a demonstration against the government and ENDF, declaring their support to Fano militia. As a result, public offices and business centers were closed.

On 2 August 2023, a group of youth closed roads with stones and sticks in Bure town (West Gojam, Amhara) and Debre Markos (coded separately), in a demonstration against the government and ENDF, declaring their support to Fano militia.

On 1 August 2023, in a clash that lasted for two days, ENDF clashed with Fano militias around Lalibela, Lasta woreda (North Wello, Amhara). The clash forced local flights not to land the Lalibela Airport and return. Some sources claimed 'Fano militias taken control of the airport', but the information not confirmed. Casualties unknown.
On 1 August 2023, ENDF clashed with Fano militias around Kobo town, Kobo (North Wello, Amhara), forcing the closure of private and public businesses in the town. Casualties unknown.

source: Al Jazeera; EMS; Reuters; Wazema Radio
notes: On 1 August 2023, ENDF and Fano militias clashed in or around Debre Tabor town (South Gondar, Amhara). At least, three civilians, including two drivers of a Bajaj and a truck, were killed and hospital sources claimed to have admitted around dozens combatants wounded. The armed clash continued the next day (coded separately). According to a witness, the armed clash began when ENDF tried to mobilize its soldiers from Gondar to Woldiya. Fano and the youth closed the roads by placing stones. The number of fatalities split in to two events, coded as 2.

Security measures: On 1 August 2023, Sekota town security council declared night time curfew starting from 8 pm and other restrictions, including disseminating false narratives and information to incite conflict between ethnic groups and carrying weapons in public in Sekota town (Wag Hamra, Amhara) in order to celebrate Shaday celebration peacefully.

On 1 August 2023, a group closed roads with stones and sticks in Dembecha ( West Gojam, Amhara) and Amanuel (coded separately), in a demonstration against the government and ENDF, declaring their support to Fano militia.
